dublin_core.dcvalue: Disease management facilitated through information technology could mean a step forward towards a more effective and efficient care of patients afflicted with chronic illnesses Focusing on diabetes the paper explores the value proposition of wireless technology in enhancing patient self management and quality of life Diabetics non compliance with prescribed treatment plans mandates the adoption of advanced tools that can support patients through automated functions e g notification reminders for taking medication decision support e g analysis of self test data and feedback and anytime anywhere communication and intervention capability e g emergency consultation by healthcare practitioner A cost benefit analysis for the mobile self management of diabetics suggests time and financial savings for both patients and the healthcare providers
M-healthcare for patient self-management: a case for diabetics.
